name: 42-jira-buddy
description: Your friendly Jira companion for VS Code with GitHub Copilot support

jiraExtension.projectKey.description: Default project key for ticket creation

jiraExtension.featureEpics.description: List of feature epic IDs for bug creation

jiraExtension.autoRefreshInterval.description: Auto-refresh interval in seconds (0 to disable)

jiraExtension.contextFileCacheExpiry.description: Context file cache expiry time in seconds (default: 3600 = 1 hour)

statusChange.description: Require confirmation before changing issue status

linkPR.description: Require confirmation before linking pull requests

jiraExtension.requireConfirmation.description: Configure which Copilot tool operations require user confirmation

jiraExtension.maxIssues.description: Maximum number of issues to fetch

jiraExtension.useDummyData.description: Use dummy data instead of connecting to Jira API (for testing UI without credentials)

languageModelTools.name: jira_get_issue_info
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves comprehensive information about a Jira issue including status, assignee, priority, description, comments, and history. Use when investigating an issue, before making updates, or when providing context about a ticket. Input: issue key (e.g., PROJ-123). Output: Full issue details with metadata.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Fetches information about a Jira issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_add_comment
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Posts a comment to a Jira issue as the authenticated user. Use when documenting work progress, providing updates, adding clarifications, or responding to discussions. Comments are visible to all team members with access to the issue. Input: issue key + comment text. Output: Confirmation of posted comment.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Adds a comment to a Jira issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_update_status
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Transitions a Jira issue to a different workflow status (e.g., 'To Do' → 'In Progress' → 'Done'). Use when updating work state, marking issues complete, or moving tickets through workflow. Automatically finds valid transitions. Requires user confirmation. Input: issue key + target status name. Output: Confirmation with new status.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Updates the status of a Jira issue

status.description: The target status name (e.g., 'In Progress', 'Done', 'To Do')

languageModelTools.name: jira_link_pr
languageModelTools.displayName: Link Pull Request to Jira Issue
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Associates a GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket pull request with a Jira issue for development traceability. Use when connecting code changes to tickets. The PR appears in the issue's development panel. Enables tracking implementation status. Input: issue key + PR URL + optional title. Output: Confirmation of link creation.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Links a pull request to a Jira issue

prUrl.description: The full URL of the pull request (e.g., https://github.com/org/repo/pull/123)

prTitle.description: Optional title for the pull request link

languageModelTools.name: jira_create_subtask
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a subtask under an existing parent issue for breaking down complex work into manageable pieces. Subtasks inherit the parent's project. Use when decomposing stories/tasks/bugs. Helps with detailed task tracking. Input: parent issue key + summary + optional description. Output: New subtask key.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates a subtask under a Jira issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_log_time
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Records time spent working on a Jira issue for time tracking and reporting. Accepts Jira time formats: '2h', '30m', '2h 30m', '1d' (8h), '1w' (40h). Optional work description. Use for timesheets and effort tracking. Requires user confirmation. Input: issue key + time + description. Output: Confirmation of logged time.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Logs work time to a Jira issue

description.description: Optional description of the work performed

languageModelTools.name: jira_create_epic
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a high-level epic for organizing related stories and tasks under a major initiative or feature. Use when planning large features or long-term work. Epics serve as parent containers for stories/tasks. Input: project key + summary + optional description. Output: New epic key and details.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates a new epic in a Jira project

languageModelTools.name: jira_create_task
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a task issue for general work items. Can be standalone or linked to a parent (epic/story). Use for action items, technical tasks, or non-story work. Provides flexibility in work organization. Input: project key + summary + optional description + optional parent key. Output: New task key.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates a new task in a Jira project

parentKey.description: Optional parent issue key (e.g., PROJ-123) to link the task to an epic or story

languageModelTools.name: jira_list_epics
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves all epics in a project with their keys, summaries, statuses, and assignees. Use when exploring project structure, finding parent epics for linking, or getting overview of major initiatives. Helpful for project planning and navigation. Input: project key + optional max results. Output: List of epics with metadata.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Lists all epics in a Jira project

maxResults.description: Maximum number of epics to return (default: 100)

languageModelTools.name: jira_assign_issue
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Changes the assignee of an issue or removes assignment. Use when delegating work, taking ownership, or unassigning completed work. Requires user accountId for assignment. Set unassign=true to clear assignee. Input: issue key + accountId OR unassign flag. Output: Confirmation with new assignee.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Assigns or unassigns a Jira issue

accountId.description: The account ID of the user to assign to

unassign.description: Set to true to unassign the issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_set_priority
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Updates issue priority to reflect urgency and importance (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Trivial). Use when triaging issues, escalating bugs, or adjusting work priority. Affects team's work ordering and attention. Input: issue key + priority name. Output: Confirmation with new priority.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Sets the priority of a Jira issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_add_watcher
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Subscribes a user to receive notifications for all changes to an issue. Use when involving stakeholders, keeping team informed, or adding observers. Watchers get updates without being assigned. Input: issue key + user accountId. Output: Confirmation of watcher addition.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Adds a watcher to a Jira issue

accountId.description: The account ID of the user to add as watcher

languageModelTools.name: jira_search_issues
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Performs advanced issue search using JQL (Jira Query Language). Use for finding issues by any criteria: status, assignee, priority, labels, dates, custom fields. Examples: 'project = PROJ AND status = Open', 'assignee = currentUser()', 'priority = High AND updated >= -7d'. Input: JQL query + max results. Output: Matching issues list.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Search for Jira issues using JQL

jql.description: The JQL query string (e.g., 'project = PROJ AND status = Open')

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 50)

languageModelTools.name: jira_get_project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Fetches project metadata: name, description, lead, project type, and settings. Use when validating project keys, understanding project context, or finding project leads. Helpful before creating issues or during project exploration. Input: project key. Output: Complete project details.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Gets details about a Jira project

languageModelTools.name: jira_create_story
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a user story for agile development workflows. Stories represent user-facing features or requirements. Can be linked to parent epic for organization. Use for product development and sprint planning. Input: project key + summary + optional description + optional parent epic. Output: New story key.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates a new story in a Jira project

languageModelTools.name: jira_create_bug
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a bug/defect issue for reporting problems, errors, or unexpected behavior. Optional priority setting (Critical, High, Medium, Low). Use for defect tracking and quality management. Helps prioritize fixes. Input: project key + summary + optional description + optional priority. Output: New bug key.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Creates a new bug in a Jira project

languageModelTools.name: jira_link_issues
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Establishes directional relationship between two issues: Blocks (dependency), Relates (connection), Duplicates (same issue), Clones (copied from), etc. Use for showing dependencies, related work, or duplicate tracking. Helps visualize issue relationships. Input: inward issue + outward issue + link type. Output: Confirmation of link.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Links two Jira issues together

languageModelTools.name: jira_add_labels
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Tags an issue with one or more labels for categorization, filtering, and organization. Labels enable custom grouping (e.g., 'frontend', 'urgent', 'technical-debt'). Use for flexible issue classification. Labels are searchable. Input: issue key + array of labels. Output: Confirmation with updated labels.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Adds labels to a Jira issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_set_sprint
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Assigns an issue to a specific sprint for agile sprint planning. Use when organizing backlog, planning iterations, or moving work between sprints. Requires sprint ID. Enables sprint-based work tracking. Input: issue key + sprint ID. Output: Confirmation of sprint assignment.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Moves an issue to a sprint

languageModelTools.name: jira_get_transitions
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all valid workflow status transitions currently available for an issue based on its current state and project workflow. Use before updating status to determine possible next states. Workflow-aware. Input: issue key. Output: Array of available transitions with IDs and names.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Gets available status transitions for an issue

languageModelTools.name: jira_bulk_update
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Applies the same field updates to multiple issues in one operation. Use for mass changes: bulk priority updates, batch label additions, multi-issue assignments, etc. Efficient for managing many issues. Reduces API calls. Input: array of issue keys + fields object. Output: Confirmation with update count.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Bulk updates multiple Jira issues

issueKeys.description: Array of issue keys to update (e.g., ['PROJ-123', 'PROJ-456'])

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
